column4: El Salvador to launch investigation into Swiss HSBC accounts
column5: SAN SALVADOR  Feb 11 El Salvador's attorney general on Wednesday said his office has launched an investigation to determine whether 54 Salvadorans were involved in opening 54 secret accounts with HSBC in Switzerland.

column4: HSBC's reforms at Swiss bank eat into profits
column5: LONDON HSBC's  Swiss private bank has seen a steep drop in profits since 2008 and even fell to a loss in 2013  showing how problems in the business have hit the British bank's bottom line as well as its reputation.

column4: HSBC's reforms at Swiss bank eat into profits
column5: LONDON  Feb 11 HSBC's Swiss private bank has seen a steep drop in profits since 2008 and even fell to a loss in 2013  showing how problems in the business have hit the British bank's bottom line as well as its reputation.

column5: VIENNA Austria has asked France to hand over tax data on clients linked with Austria after HSBC Holdings Plc  admitted failings in compliance at its Swiss private bank.

column4: Belgian judge withdraws arrest threat for HSBC directors
column5: HSBC has offered to co-operate with Belgian authorities and as a result a judge has withdrawn his threat to issue international arrest warrants against senior directors of its Swiss private banking arm  Brussels prosecutors said on Wednesday.

column4: Fitch Affirms Kimberly-Clark's IDR at 'A'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  February 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Kimberly-Clark  Corporation's (KMB) ratings as follows: --Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'A'; --Short-term IDR at 'F1'; --$2 billion commercial paper (CP) program at 'F1'; --$200 million dealer remarketable securities at 'A'/'F1'; --$2 billion revolving credit facility at 'A'; --Senior unsecured notes and debentures at 'A'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. Approximately $6.

column4: Fitch Affirms Lincoln National Corp.'s IDR at 'A-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  February 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Lincoln National  Corporation's (LNC) Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'A-'  and the  Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) ratings of LNC's insurance operating  subsidiaries at 'A+'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. A full list of rating  actions follows at the end of this release. KEY RATING DRIVERS Today's rating actions reflect LNC's solid overall operating performance  strong

column4: Petrobras Brazil offshore explosion kills three  six missing
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO At least three workers were killed and 10 injured on Wednesday by an explosion on an offshore oil and gas platform operated by state-run Petrobras  a disaster that could further hurt the reputation of a company struggling with a corruption scandal and safety concerns.

column5: OSLO  Feb 11 Norway's BW Offshore confirmed on Wednesday that one of its offshore oil and natural gas production vessels operating in Brazil for Petrobras  suffered an explosion  killing at least three people.

column5: Feb 11 (IFR) - Andean and Mexican names outperformed in a flight-to-safety bid Wednesday as investors shed oil names and stayed clear of credits associated with the scandal at Brazil's Petrobras.

column5: SAO PAULO  Feb 11 Financial bourse BM&FBovespa SA is working on a plan to improve corporate governance rules for Brazilian state-controlled companies  Chief Executive Officer Edemir Pinto said on Wednesday  in response to a corruption scandal engulfing oil producer Petróleo Brasileiro SA.

column5: BRASILIA Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras)  plans to publish its delayed audited fourth-quarter results by the end of March  something it needs to do to avoid possible early repayment of its bonds  the Globo newspaper said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Petrobras CEO says has 'full autonomy'  questions graft loss
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Feb 10 The new chief executive officer of Brazil's Petrobras said on Tuesday that he has full autonomy to dictate its own fuel-pricing policy and protect cash  even as he questioned the size of losses stemming from a giant corruption scandal.

column5: BRASILIA For the first time since a corruption scandal erupted at Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras last year  senior opposition politicians are publicly floating the possibility of impeaching President Dilma Rousseff.

column4: Canada's Shaw Comms reorganizes service unit; to pay workers to move
column5: TORONTO  Feb 11 Canadian cable company Shaw Communications Inc said on Wednesday it will shut customer care facilities in its Alberta stronghold while beefing up facilities elsewhere  and offered 1 600 workers C$7 500 ($5 936) each to follow their jobs.

column4: Sprint says U.S. telecoms will invest despite stronger net neutrality
column5: SAN FRANCISCO With its surprise endorsement of a stricter U.S. regulatory regime for Internet service providers  Sprint Corp  wanted to show that tougher rules would not stop rival telecom players from investing  Chief Technology Officer Stephen Bye said in an interview.

column4: Sun Life posts lower profit  says 2015 on track

column4: France's Sigfox raises $115 million for 'Internet of Things' network
column5: LONDON French startup Sigfox has raised $115 million from seven heavyweight investors to help it build new networks globally to connect everything from washing machines to smart meters to the Internet.

column4: Strong dollar  low oil remain net positives: Fed's Fisher
column5: NEW YORK Short-term currency moves should not drive the Federal Reserve's policy decisions and  for now  the strong dollar and low global oil prices are a net positive for the U.S. economy  Dallas Fed President Richard Fisher said on Wednesday.

column4: Strong dollar  low oil remain net positives -Fed's Fisher
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 11 Short-term currency moves should not drive the Federal Reserve's policy decisions and  for now  the strong dollar and low global oil prices are a net positive for the U.S. economy  Dallas Fed President Richard Fisher said on Wednesday.

column4: TransCanada says to decide on Quebec oil terminal by March 31

column4: UPDATE 1-TransCanada opposes U.S. EPA on Keystone carbon footprint
column5: Feb 11 TransCanada Corp rejected the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's inference that its Keystone XL pipeline would help increase the rate of oil sands production even at lower oil prices  and raise greenhouse gas emissions.

column4: TransCanada disagrees with U.S. EPA on Keystone carbon footprint
column5: TransCanada Corp said it rejected the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's inference that its Keystone XL pipeline would increase the rate of oil sands production at lower oil prices  and raise greenhouse gas emissions.

column4: Valeant to buy bankrupt vaccine maker Dendreon
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  will scoop up bankrupt cancer vaccine maker Dendreon Corp  after no additional qualified bids came forward by Tuesday's deadline  Valeant said.

column4: Valeant to buy bankrupt vaccine maker Dendreon
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  will scoop up bankrupt cancer vaccine maker Dendreon Corp   after no additional qualified bids came forward by Tuesday's deadline  Valeant said.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Valeant to buy bankrupt vaccine maker Dendreon
column5: Feb 10 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  will scoop up bankrupt cancer vaccine maker Dendreon Corp  after no additional qualified bids came forward by Tuesday's deadline  Valeant said.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St ends flat while investors await Greece  Ukraine news
column5: * Indexes: Dow off 0.04 pct  S&P flat  Nasdaq up 0.28 pct   (Updates to late afternoon  adds commentary)

column4: Wal-Mart says to invest $269 million in Canada
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said it would invest about C$340 million ($269 million) this fiscal year to expand in Canada  lower than what it had budgeted for last year.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart says to invest C$340 mln in Canada
column5: Feb 11 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it would invest about C$340 million ($269.16 million) this fiscal year to expand in Canada  lower than what it had budgeted for last year.

column4: Wal-Mart says to invest C$340 mln in Canada
column5: Feb 11 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it would invest about C$340 million ($269.16 million) to boost its presence in Canada this fiscal year.

column4: Insurer WellCare's profit beats estimates on strong enrollments
column5: U.S. health insurer WellCare Health Plans Inc's  fourth-quarter adjusted profit marginally beat average analysts' estimate  as the company maintained its strong enrollment rate.

column4: UPDATE 2-Insurer WellCare's profit beats estimates on strong enrollments
column5: Feb 11 U.S. health insurer WellCare Health Plans Inc's fourth-quarter adjusted profit marginally beat average analysts' estimate  as the company maintained its strong enrollment rate.

column4: Severe flu season sends WellCare Health profit down 82 pct
column5: Feb 11 Health insurer WellCare Health Plans Inc  reported a 82 percent fall in quarterly profit  due to expenses related to severe flu season in the United States.

column4: Fitch: Xinyuan's Ratings Not Impacted By Consent Solicitation
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) HONG KONG  February 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings says today that ratings on Xinyuan  Real Estate Co.  Ltd. (Xinyuan; B+/Negative) and its bonds due in 2018 and 2019  will not be impacted even if the proposed amendments in the consent solicitation  announced on 3 February 2014 are adopted. The principal purpose of the consent solicitation is to amend the indentures of  the company's 2018 and 2019 notes to give the company more flexibility in

column4: Yamana Gold reports fourth-quarter loss on impairment charges
column5: Feb 11 Yamana Gold Inc reported a fourth-quarter loss on Wednesday after writing down the value of mines in Brazil and Chile.

column4: UPDATE 1-Yamana Gold to build gold-silver mine in Argentina
column5: Feb 11 Yamana Gold Inc will go ahead with the construction of a mine at its Cerro Moro gold and silver project in Argentina  the Toronto-based gold miner said on Wednesday.

column4: Yamana Gold to build gold-silver mine in Argentina
column5: Feb 11 Yamana Gold Inc will go ahead with building a mine at its Cerro Morro gold and silver project in Argentina  the Toronto-based gold miner said on Wednesday.

column4: Two security guards shot dead at B2Gold Philippines mine
column5: VANCOUVER Two security guards at B2Gold Corp's Masbate gold mine in the Philippines have been shot dead  the small Canadian gold mining company said on Wednesday  eight months after a security guard was shot dead at the same mine.

column4: Two security guards shot dead at B2Gold Philippines mine
column5: VANCOUVER  Feb 11 Two security guards at B2Gold Corp's Masbate gold mine in the Philippines have been shot dead  the small Canadian gold mining company said on Wednesday  eight months after a security guard was shot dead at the same mine.

column4: Canada's PGM expects new mine to produce 275 000 oz by 2017
column5: CAPE TOWN  Feb 11 Canadian miner Platinum Group Metals (PGM) plans to begin production at its new $500 million South African mine by next year before ramping up to full production of 275 000 ounces a year in 2017  its CEO said.
